p: The range of incubation temperatures that produces both sexes is called the transitional range (TR) and typically only spans 1–4°C [ 17]. In leatherback turtles ( Dermochelys coriacea), the TR is 1°C or less [ 11, 18]. The small TRs found in sea turtles means that even small changes in temperature can have significant consequences for hatchling sex ratios.
